# llms.txt - Information for LLM Crawlers
# tyingshoelaces.com - Open Source Agent Orchestration Platform

# About
> tyingshoelaces.com is an open-source platform for AI agent orchestration built with Rust.
> It provides a framework for building, deploying, and managing AI agents with support for
> A2A (Agent-to-Agent) communication, MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers, and OAuth authentication.

# Main Sections
- /: Landing page and application interface
- /blog/: Technical blog covering AI agents, system design, and implementation details
- /api/v1/health: Health check endpoint

# Technology Stack
- Backend: Rust (Axum, SQLx, Tokio)
- Frontend: React with TypeScript
- Database: PostgreSQL
- Protocols: A2A (Agent-to-Agent), MCP (Model Context Protocol), JSON-RPC 2.0

# Key Features
- Agent orchestration and lifecycle management
- MCP server integration for tool usage
- OAuth/JWT authentication with RBAC
- Real-time agent communication via A2A protocol
- Extensible plugin architecture

# Documentation
For detailed documentation and source code, visit:
- GitHub: https://github.com/ejbills/systemprompt
- Blog: https://tyingshoelaces.com/blog/

# Contact
- Author: Edward Burton
- Website: https://tyingshoelaces.com
